positions.description: We’re actively hiring across several key roles. Don’t see your dream job listed? Reach out anyway — we’re always looking for standout talent.

text.0: We don't do cookie-cutter consulting. We partner with ambitious businesses to reimagine their future — and we're looking for a Strategic Consultant who's ready to lead that charge.
text.1: This role isn't just about giving advice. It's about crafting sharp, forward-looking strategies that solve real problems and spark measurable change. Whether you're helping a fintech navigate global expansion, transforming the marketing engine of a scaling SaaS, or reworking an enterprise's operating model — your work will live where insight meets execution.
text.2: You'll collaborate closely with senior leadership, both internally and on the client side, guiding cross-functional teams with clarity and confidence. You'll bring structure to chaos, uncover opportunities in complexity, and help clients make decisions that drive long-term impact.

requirements.0: 3+ years in business, strategy, or marketing consulting, ideally in a fast-paced or client-facing environment.
requirements.1: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to distill ambiguity into clarity — and clarity into action.
requirements.2: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a natural ability to build trust with stakeholders.
requirements.3: A bias for execution: you're not just a thinker, you're a builder — someone who wants to see real results.
requirements.4: Comfort with cross-functional collaboration and managing multiple workstreams with efficiency.
requirements.5: Confidence without ego — you lead with curiosity, not arrogance. You know when to own the room and when to ask the better question.

responsibilities.0: Leading high-stakes, high-impact client engagements across marketing, operations, and corporate strategy.
responsibilities.1: Designing growth roadmaps, market entry strategies, and operating models tailored to evolving business realities.
responsibilities.2: Synthesizing data, trends, and stakeholder insight into strategic narratives and clear, actionable solutions.
responsibilities.3: Driving collaboration across teams — aligning product, marketing, operations, and executive leadership.
responsibilities.4: Presenting to C-suite decision-makers, defending ideas with confidence, and adapting quickly based on feedback.
responsibilities.5: Acting not just as a consultant, but as a trusted strategic partner who brings calm to complexity and momentum to inertia.

summary.text: This role is ideal for someone who wants to be more than a slide-builder — someone who wants to lead change, shape industries, and see the tangible impact of their work. At Optisence, you'll find a culture that celebrates sharp thinking, bold ideas, and strategic precision — all grounded in collaboration, not hierarchy.

text.0: We believe great marketing doesn’t just look good — it performs. We're seeking a Marketing Performance Analyst who can dive into the data ocean, surface the insights that matter, and turn numbers into narratives that drive growth.
text.1: In this role, you won’t just be crunching numbers in the background. You’ll be embedded in our core strategic operations — working alongside consultants, creatives, and clients to turn marketing into a measurable growth engine. You’ll make sense of signals across funnels, platforms, and audiences — helping us decode what’s working, what’s not, and where the next opportunity lies.
text.2: This is more than reporting. This is decision-driving. This is strategy-shaping. This is analytics that earns a seat at the table.

requirements.0: Hands-on experience with GA4, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau, or similar marketing analytics platforms.
requirements.1: A solid understanding of core marketing metrics and KPIs — CAC, LTV, ROI, CTR, bounce rate, conversion rates — and how to improve them.
requirements.2: Comfort working across multiple data sources and digital platforms (Google Ads, Meta, CRM tools, etc.).
requirements.3: A curious, pattern-seeking mind with the ability to turn data into clear, actionable insight.
requirements.4: The soul of a storyteller — you can frame data in a way that engages, persuades, and drives action.
requirements.5: A knack for simplifying complex information into actionable recommendations.

responsibilities.0: Building and maintaining dashboards that tell the story behind the numbers — in tools like GA4, Looker Studio, and Power BI.
responsibilities.1: Tracking full-funnel performance across digital campaigns, from awareness to conversion to retention.
responsibilities.2: Surfacing actionable insights that help our marketing teams and clients optimize spend, creative, and targeting.
responsibilities.3: Identifying leading indicators and anomalies before they become problems (or opportunities missed).
responsibilities.4: Translating complex data into clean, compelling visuals and strategic recommendations for both internal teams and client presentations.

summary.text: This role is for someone who doesn’t just analyze — they anticipate. Someone who’s obsessed with connecting marketing effort to business outcome, and who thrives in an environment where analytics is seen not as support, but as a strategic superpower.

text.0: Business development isn’t about pushing services — it’s about crafting relevance, building trust, and creating the kinds of partnerships that unlock real business transformation.
text.1: We’re looking for a Business Development Lead who sees beyond quotas and pipelines. Someone who can translate strategic potential into real-world outcomes. Someone who can walk into a conversation with a CMO or COO, understand their pain points, and articulate not just what we offer — but how we solve. You'll be shaping how companies discover us, engage with us, and grow with us.
text.2: This role is equal parts strategist, relationship builder, and deal-closer — and it sits at the heart of our growth engine.

requirements.0: You’ve done this before — 3+ years of demonstrable success in B2B business development, ideally in consulting, SaaS, or marketing services.
requirements.1: You combine strategic thinking with hustle — understanding not just how to close deals, but how to open meaningful conversations.
requirements.2: You’re a natural communicator with exceptional storytelling skills — able to frame value, tailor messaging, and build credibility fast.
requirements.3: You think like a founder — driven by results, hungry for growth, and comfortable with ambiguity.
requirements.4: You thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments where initiative and experimentation are encouraged.

responsibilities.0: Leading and executing outreach strategies that cut through noise and land with clarity — email, LinkedIn, events, partnerships.
responsibilities.1: Building and nurturing relationships with key B2B decision-makers, from first touch to signed deal.
responsibilities.2: Driving the sales cycle from lead generation through to proposal development and contract negotiation.
responsibilities.3: Representing Optisence at virtual and in-person events, conferences, and executive briefings — being the voice of our brand.
responsibilities.4: Working closely with our consulting and marketing teams to shape offers that meet real market needs.
responsibilities.5: Tracking sales performance, refining strategies, and uncovering new revenue opportunities through feedback loops and market intelligence.

summary.text: This isn’t just a sales role — it’s a growth leadership role. You’ll help define not just what we sell, but how we scale. You’ll be part of a team that values intelligence, insight, and integrity over pressure tactics and pushy sales. And most importantly, you’ll help build the next chapter of Optisence — one relationship at a time.
